title: For A Century, Thanksgiving's Must-Haves Were Celery And Olives
teaser: Ari Shapiro speaks with Boston Globe editor Hilary Sargent on the use of celery and olives as popular meal items during Thanksgivings of the past and their eventual fade from popularity.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
